text: Step 1. Set Up Your Device (One-Time Setup)
Before measuring, you need to calibrate your device once.
Tap the Blue Eye icon, then tap the down arrow to open the Sub Menu Bar.
Tap the screen twice to draw a straight line and measure it with a ruler.
The displayed length will not match the real size yet — this is normal.
Open Settings and enter the actual width of your phone screen (measure from the left edge to the right edge using a ruler).
This setup only needs to be done once.
Step 2. Draw and Measure (Daily Use)
Open the Blue Eye page.
Tap or drag to draw lines or shapes.
When a shape is completed, the perimeter and area are calculated automatically.
Spending even one minute per day counts as active usage during testing.
Step 3. Prepare a Reference Photo (Optional, for Higher Accuracy)
To measure real-world objects more accurately:
Place an A4 sheet of paper on a table or wall.
Take a photo so the paper is clearly visible.
Save the photo to your gallery.
Step 4. Perspective Calibration (Red Eye)
Open the Red Eye page and tap '<' to open the Side Toolbars.
Load the saved photo from your gallery.
Create a rectangle by tapping the four corners of the reference object (such as an A4 sheet).
Enter the actual width and height of the rectangle in the input fields.
This creates a reference plane for perspective correction.
Step 5. Convert Screen Values to Real-World Measurements
After drawing the object on the Blue Eye page, return to the Red Eye page.
Tap the convert arrow (→) button.
Screen values (mm) are converted into real-world measurements (cm, mm, etc.). This is the core purpose of the app.
Step 6. Provide Feedback
If you experience:
Incorrect measurements
Device compatibility issues
Unexpected behavior
Please share your feedback with us.
Your feedback directly helps improve the app.
Step 7. Rate the App
If you find Measure Master useful:
Open the app page on Google Play.
Scroll down.
Leave a rating.
Thank you for helping us improve!
Why This Matters (For Testers)
Google Play looks for:
Active testing
User feedback
Visible improvements during the testing period
Your participation truly makes a difference.
